studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 5.2.1.2.1 - Immune-Related Events and Dose Modification
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated dose modification and toxicity management guidelines for immune-related adverse events (irAEs) and associated tables.
Clarified the status of COVID-19 vaccines as allowed concomitant medication.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 5.11 - Clinical Criteria for Early Trial Termination
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated criteria to allow for earlier study termination flexibility.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 5.10 - Beginning and End of the Trial
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added provisions for subject enrollment into a pembrolizumab extension study.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Requested by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to harmonize safety information across all FDA-approved PD-1/L1 antibody prescribing information.
To clarify the concomitant use of COVID-19 vaccines.
To add flexibility to allow the study to terminate before the planned completion date.
To align text with legal requirements to obtain informed consent documentation.

studyChanges.afterText: Updated dose modification and toxicity management guidelines for irAEs and table.
studyChanges.summary: Harmonized irAE management tables with FDA-approved prescribing information for PD-1/L1 antibodies.

studyChanges.afterText: Any COVID-19 vaccine that is licensed in a given country is allowed in the study.
studyChanges.summary: Added explicit allowance for licensed COVID-19 vaccines.

studyChanges.afterText: Upon study completion, subjects may be enrolled in a pembrolizumab extension study, if available.
studyChanges.summary: Added language regarding transition to extension studies.

studyChanges.afterText: If subjects are rerandomized, each subject will retain his/her original treatment/randomization number.
studyChanges.summary: Clarified subject ID retention for extension study enrollment.
General editorial updates for clarity throughout the document.
